data.title: Outstanding Food and Service
data.text:
Having eaten at the original Din Tai Fung in Shanghai and the one in Arcadia, I've been curious how this Glendale location compares. Since I'm not a fan of waiting in long lines to eat at a restaurant, I decided to come on a weekday near opening time.

We arrived at 11:10 am (they open at 11 am) and there were no lines of people waiting to get seated. We were pleasantly greeted by the hostess staff and led to a table. This Glendale location is not that big, so it's no wonder there are long wait times when they are busy.

We ordered the xiao long bao (soup dumplings), cucumber salad, spicy won tons, braised beef noodle soup and shrimp & pork shu mai. The dishes were brought out one at a time in a timely manner. Everything was delicious, especially the sauce that comes with the spicy won tons.

The service was pleasant and efficient. Our bill for a filling lunch for two was around $51. Not bad for a delicious lunch at an iconic soup dumpling restaurant!  We will definitely be back!  They also validate for parking at the Americana parking structure.

data.title: Super yummy
data.text:
Ok you have to go here! Food is excellent. We go as a family and I have picky children. They love it. I will say the wait time is for ever. I don't think you can reserve and at some times you will be waiting for a good hour. 
Cocktails are super yummy. This really is the sort of place to after a long day at work with the kids and relax and have fun.

data.title: So good!
data.text: I've been wanting to try their location in Santa Clara, CA but reservations aren't easy to get. Took a trip to nearby Burbank and drove to Glendale to finally try it. I was worried there would be a long wait since it was lunchtime but thankfully we were seated immediately. Our server was very friendly and explained different menu items. We ordered a variety of dishes to share and loved everything! Fried rice, pork chops, shrimp & pork dumplings, pork & crab dumplings. Wish we had room for dessert but we were stuffed!

data.title: Excellent hand made soup dumplings
data.text: My wife and I ate at this restaurant early one evening and got in without a reservation. But by the time we left there was a long line to get in. The hand made soup dumplings were excellent. Our server was very friendly and walked us through the menu and made some good recommendations. We got several types of the handmade soup dumplings as well as some perfectly cooked bok choy and friend rice. We had a decent bottle of wine and a great dinner. This is an excellent dim sum restaurant.

data.title: Do not miss
data.text: Granted I love soup dumplings, but these were top notch. The truffle pork dumplings were particularly good. The sauces and condiments matched well and the price at lunch was a steal. I sat at the bar as the place was packed on a weekday. Knowing beforehand how to eat soup dumplings prevents a mess.

data.title: Dumplings?  Who knew??
data.text:
Of course, millions of Chinese know about dumplings, as does a smaller subset of westerners, but I had never gotten Chinese dumplings, thinking that they were heavy potato-based mashes.  Not so.  Not at all.

I was with an Asian friend who knew what to order and I followed his lead, and he and DTF didn't disappoint.  I was blown away by the tastes.

We had small pork dumplings that had soup inside.  Yes, soup.  Wonderfully lite broth that complimented the pork meat perfectly.  We munched on some of the finest garlic spinach I've ever had.  Then we had beautifully prepared shrimp dumplings that had a bottom section and a top section on each morsel.  It was wonderful!  We also munched on fresh, crunchy and tasty green beans.  We washed it all down with light and tasty hot tea that was wonderful.

I'm now a dumpling fan, and I hope to spread the gospel of Chinese dumplings with friends and family.

data.title: Get there early on weekends
data.text: It opens at 10:00 on weekends & we arrived about 9:40. A line forms inside as soon as the doors open & they seat people in a very orderly fashion. The special weekend dumplings are only available until they run out. Delicious & not at all odd for a brunch. Lots of vegetarian choices. Everything we've ever tried has been good. I especially enjoyed the 7 (or 8?) treasure sticky rice dessert this time. Yummy.

data.title: Definitely a #1 food experience
data.text: There are about 400 restaurants in Glendale and this was rated #1 on TA when we ate there. I agree with that ranking based on dinner. But I probably won't eat at the other 399 and it's possible there is someplace with equally exceptional food and better service. The service was excellent but not exceptional. My water glass sat empty for about 10 minutes (and that was my only beverage). Other than that it was top tier. The menu is divided into sections of food type making it easy to pick a bit of everything. The dim sum can be ordered as a half order, at exactly half price, and most plates are 10 pieces so that's a great way to try more things. If we weren't in a hotel I probably would have ordered more and taken it home in one of their designer to-go bags. Valet parking is validated up to 3 hours and Americana garage parking is 100% validated. The value is good, especially for a #1 restaurant in a high rent district. We had six items (3 half items) for under $50 and that was completely filling.

data.title: Followed TripAdvisor
data.text: Being for business in Glendale I try to explore restaurants were I can have a quick bite. I thought dim sung fit the bill and I was not disappointed. Although there was a wait of 30 minutes when I arrived, I could eat at the bar in 5 minutes. I was well attended to and had a great and tasty meal with wonton soup and vegetarian dim sung. I would definitely go back with more company, so the dishes can be shared. Excellent and friendly service at the bar.

data.title: Dumplings!!!
data.text: We dine here almost every time we visit LA. It's just one of those places you can't not eat at when you're in town. The dumplings are to die for. They are so, so good! We have to wait at least 30 minutes or longer to be seated every time but the food is totally worth the wait.

data.title: Always worth the wait!
data.text: Din Tae Fung is the gold standard for dumplings. I've been to the restaurants in Shanghai and Singapore, and the Glendale location (despite being in a shopping mall) was no disappointment. Din Tae Fung brings the dumpling -- or xiao long bao, as they are called in Chinese-- experience to a whole new level. The cucumber salad, in which cucs are perfectly stacked on a plate and drizzled with hot chile oil, vinegar and sprinkled with hot red pepper. This was followed by the pork soup dumplings -- take a bite and the soup explodes in your mouth. The entrees also are mouthwatering. For dessert, don't pass up the red bean Xiao long bao.

data.title: Great Experience!
data.text: This was a great dining experience.  The original location in Hong Kong has won Michelin stars, and there are a number of locations throughout the world.  The food was great, came out in a very timely fashion, and was reasonably priced.  Also, the restaurant decor was nice, with good ambience. The wait is long, so show up earlier than you anticipate on eating.  They will call you when your table is ready.  Just browse one of the many surrounding shops to kill time and wait for the call.  Overall, very satisfied!

data.title: So worth the wait
data.text:
This was my first dim sum type of experience and man was it worth the wait. We waited for about forty minutes and ate dinner at 9:45pm, but I wouldn't trade our experience. 

We had the thin pork dumplings with soup inside. We also had the thick pork and shrimp dumplings. My boyfriend had the braised beef soup and I had the plain beef soup.

Everything paired perfectly. The chef has a Michelin star and you can tell. I was also pleasantly surprised that it didn't break the bank. We had a very special dining experience and left there feeling very full.

data.title: Delicious dumplings!
data.text: This restaurant is known for its xiaolongbao (soup dumplings), and they do not disappoint here.  The décor of the restaurant is quite modern, and the noise level can be on the louder side (but not uncomfortable).  This restaurant can be quite busy, just like their other locations, but you can add your name to a system that will text you 5-10 minutes before you are going to be seated.  When I visited, this was also one of the few places that would validate for valet parking at this shopping center.

data.title: Oh, so wonderful!
data.text:
I had lunch here on Friday.  I'm no culinary expert, but this was the most amazing meal I've had in quite awhile.  Absolutely delicious.
We had the Spinach and garlic, the soup dumplings, another dumpling stuffed with shrimp, another pork dumpling in a delicious sauce, a soup with the most tender beef ever, and two other dishes I just can't recall.
This place is a must.

data.title: Go here if you love atmosphere more than food and have time to kill
data.text: Very nice atmosphere, food is bleh. Come here if you don't mind greasy food, and if you want your soup dumplings to turn cold in an instant right before you because they run away with the cover of the dish before you can even stop them while you're eating other dishes.  And then when you tell the waiter to bring the cover back he takes five minutes to get it so that your food is definitely cold. Even though he says he understands that the dish will be completely ruined and has to be eaten hot. When your soup dumplings are completely cold because they didn't serve it properly, you ask the waiter if your food can be reheated. He says no. Then he says "oh I know what you're trying to do, you're trying to get another free order out of this". Appallingly rude. Then an ineffectual manager who doesn't even offer any consolation or compensation tells you it's your job to pin the runner down if he runs away with the cover of your dumplings. This place is supposed to be specializing in soup dumplings, they have the responsibility to you serve it to you so that it's edible and not disgusting congealed grease

data.title: One of my favorite restaurants!
data.text:
If you don't already know about this place, you're missing out. Great dumplings and dim sum/Asian fare. 

I try to eat here anytime I'm near one on my frequent business travels.  I take all my colleagues here and typically they agree that this place is fantastic.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Really great dumplings!!! Delicious food. I always enjoy my meals here as do the people I go with (so it's not just me) - there's a lot of hype but I think it's one of the rare places that actually lives up to the hype

data.title: Outstanding food with fabulous service
data.text: Our party of four adults and two small children arrived about 30 minutes after opening on a Sunday morning and had a brief (10 minute) wait while a table was turned for us.  Even with picky eaters and a vegetarian we had a multitude of choices of soup, dumplings, desserts and beverages.  Our server Andrew was helpful, knowledgable, and highly attentive.  The food was outstanding with great subtlety of flavors and textures.  Having had Dim Sum in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Toronto, London and New York this was among the best ever.

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text: Went back to this restaurant today... only a 35-45 minute wait!  Went for it!  It was 45+ minutes, but worth the wait!  The so up dumplings were as amazing as ever, but this time h ad 4 diners, so we tried a few more things.  Everything was good, but the shrimp dumpling soup was to die for.  Try it, you'll like it!!!
